main.name: Nick Figgins
main.description: Currently, I'm looking for full-time opportunities starting after my graduation in May 2021
main.bio: Use this bio section as your way of describing yourself and saying what you do, what technologies you like to use or feel most comfortable with, describing your personality, or whatever else you feel like throwing in.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: B.A. in Computer Science; B.A. in Mathematics

education.description: I also received my General Certificate from Lord Fairfax Community College for the completion of 30 college credits while in high-school (I completed 61 total).

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: I'm working as a back-end engineer for the Callie mobile app and its microservice architecture (Node.js).

work.title: Coding Instructor
work.description: I'm teaching courses to students K-12 on various programming languages and concepts, including Java, boolean logic, and game design with Lua (C++ scripting language).

work.company: University of Virginia - Security Operations Center
work.title: Information Security Intern

research.subject: Adversarial Machine Learning Malware Classification
research.title: Undergraduate Researcher
research.description: I'm currently researching defenses to evasive attacks towards Windows malware classifiers. In particular, I'm looking into defenses against the easily perturbed headers of PE files, which has been the focus of recent attack algorithms.

projects.title: Doctor-Patient Real-time Translator
projects.category: Voice translator for doctors/patients and PDF generator for translated doctor's orders. Tech: Angular

projects.title: Proof of Alternating Harmonic Series
projects.category: My construction of a proof of the alternating harmonic series.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
